title: Enodia
extract:
Ennodia (also Enodia and Einodia) (Greek: Ἐννοδία, the one in the streets) was an ancient Greek goddess, identified in certain areas or by certain ancient writers with Artemis, Hecate or Persephone.

Timarete of Corinth, who died in Pella, Macedonia in the late 5th century BC, is the only attested priestess of this Goddess.

References

Further reading

  • Graninger, C. D. "The Regional Cults of Thessaly" (2006 dissertation)
  • Chrysostomou, P. "Η Θεσσαλική θεά Εν(ν)οδία ή Φεραία θεά". Athens, 1998.
